intro: Struthanthus dentatus, commonly known as the toothed flax or desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring gray-green leaves with serrated edges. Its showy, yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Struthanthus dentatus is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
